Returns: The current index from 0...n or -1 if the list is empty.
getCurrentIndex().Description: Get the index of the current history item. This index can be used to directly index into the array list.

getItemAtIndex(int).Description: Get the history item at the given index. The index range is from 0...n where 0 is the first item and n is the last item.

getSize().Description: Get the total size of the back/forward list.

getCurrentItem().Description: Return the current history item. This method returns null if the list is empty.

clone().Description: Clone the entire object to be used in the UI thread by clients of WebView. This creates a copy that should never be modified by any of the webkit package classes. On Android 4.4 and later there is no need to use this, as the object is already a read-only copy of the internal state.

ClassDesc: This class contains the back/forward list for a WebView. WebView.copyBackForwardList() will return a copy of this class used to inspect the entries in the list.
